{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=R6200 |revision=v1 |series=AC1200 |upc=606449084498 |asin=B008HO9DIG |price=180 |est_release_date=07/06/2012 |fcc_date=07/03/2012 |manuf_country=China |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model=U12H192 |manuf_rev=T01 |availability=now |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PY312100189 |ic_id=4054A-12100189 |pcb_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4718A1 |cpu1_cspeed=480 |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L12845EZNI-10G |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W9751G6KB-25 |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe, USB 2.0, |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4718A1 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module=Foxconn T77H403 |wi2_module_if=Mini PCIe (oversized) |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4352 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53125 |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz PA;Skyworks;SE2528L;Sige, 2528L, 206BF;2; |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui=28:C6:8E |oui_eth=28:C6:8E }} {{TagLine|DualBand AC1200 Wireless Smart Gigabit Router}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.netgear.com/home/products/networking/wifi-routers/R6200.aspx}}{{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=R6200}}
"Foxconn U12H192T01 LF" is silkscreened on the main board.
===Teardown=== *[http://www.chipworks.com/blog/recentteardowns/2012/09/04/comparing-netgears-r6300-and-r6200-ac-routers-big-wins-for-broadcom-and-skyworks/ ChipWorks dissected Netgear R6200/R6300] (internal images) :• The device uses BCM4718A1 and BCM4352 (this was not entirely unexpected) :• [[Broadcom]] BCM53125 - 10/100/1000 (GbE) Switch :• [[Foxconn]] T77H391 P/N - BCM4360 wireless module (same P/N and Broadcom :ref. design for the BCM4352 module in the [[Netgear R6200]]) Silkscreened with the [[Broadcom]] logo, "BCM94360MCH5", and the [[Foxconn]] T77H391 P/N :ChipWorks noted the dies for the BCM4360 and BCM4352 as being the same.
===See also=== *[[Netgear R6200]] • [[Foxconn T77H403]] (T00) - [[Broadcom]] BCM4352 ()2T2R) *[[Netgear R6300]] • [[Foxconn T77H391]] - [[Broadcom]] BCM4360 (3T3R) :*[[Broadcom BCM94360MC]] (H5)
